qas.question: An activist in the Arab spring said they were using Facebook to what?
An activist in the Arab spring said they were using Twitter to do what?
An activist in the Arab spring said they were using youtube to do what?
Who was the co-sponsor of the condemnation by the US Senate over the kony 2012 video?
What year was the first youtube question asked to a presidential nominee?
Who did YouTube partner with to engage people in the 2010 presidential debates?

plausible_answers.text: organizing the political unrest involved using "Facebook to schedule the protests, Twitter to coordinate, and YouTube to tell the world."

qas.question: What did Philip N. Howard say about 2012's Arab Spring?

plausible_answers.text: more than a third of the U.S. Senate introduced a resolution condemning Joseph Kony

qas.question: What happened 12 days after the "Kony 2016" video was posted on YouTube?
Who spoke about Kony's demise after the "Kony 2016" video?

context: YouTube has enabled people to more directly engage with government, such as in the <b5_0>CNN<b5_0/>/YouTube presidential debates (<a4_0>2007<a4_0/>) in which ordinary people submitted questions to U.S. presidential candidates via YouTube video, with a techPresident co-founder saying that Internet video was changing the political landscape. Describing the Arab Spring (2010- ), sociologist Philip N. Howard quoted an activist's succinct description that <b6_0>organizing the political unrest involved using "Facebook to <a0_0>schedule the protests<a0_0/>, Twitter to <a1_0>coordinate<a1_0/>, and YouTube to <a2_0>tell the world<a2_0/>."<b6_0/> In 2012, <b7_0>more than a third of the U.S. Senate introduced a resolution condemning Joseph Kony<b7_0/> 16 days after the "Kony 2012" video was posted to YouTube, with resolution co-sponsor <a3_0><b8_0>Senator Lindsey Graham<b8_0/><a3_0/> remarking that the video "will do more to lead to (Kony's) demise than all other action combined."
